title: High School: Human Anatomy and Physiology
subject: Science (2018-)

document.title: Mississippi College- and Career-Readiness Standards for Science

B733F101B0A74976888906C51C7B9F4D.description: Research and analyze the causes and effects of various pathological conditions and other kidney abnormalities (e.g., kidney stones, urinary tract infections, gout, dialysis, and incontinence).

32E6817BCCCC4A66932DE7E60D5C9EEA.description: Develop and use models to illustrate the path of urine through the urinary tract.

19EE501FB0104A52BCED7862BBCFA8A0.description: Enrichment: Conduct a urinalysis to compare the composition of urine from various "patients."

F0F38BA01BCC4BE891F4A5A9CF3DF66E.description: Investigate relationship between urine composition and the maintenance of blood sugar, blood pressure, and blood volume.

9DFF7141F89345CDBC1DDE49FBFA57FD.description: Describe the processes of filtration and selective reabsorption within the nephrons as it relates to the formation of urine and excretion of excess materials in the blood.

D501FF109CBE47E3B32146A68E5DD6BE.description: Understand the structure and function of the urinary system in relation to maintenance of homeostasis.

B0DB2B223830477AA4F61C64FB971A2F.description: Students will investigate the structures and functions of the urinary system, including the cause and effect of diseases and disorders.

CF98462F8948466BB164BD9A12616185.description: Enrichment: Use an engineering design process to develop effective treatments for gastrointestinal diseases (e.g., methods to regulate stomach acids or soothe ulcers, treat food intolerance, and dietary requirements/modifications).

9AB44D27592247F1BC2024EAE24B07F2.description: Research and analyze the causes and effects of various pathological conditions (e.g., GERD/acid reflux, stomach ulcers, lactose intolerance, irritable bowel syndrome, gallstones, appendicitis, and hormonal imbalances and obesity).

4AED4B86B4BA4DEAA2993D51BDFC22FB.description: Evaluate the role of hormones (i.e., gastrin, leptin, and insulin) in the regulation of hunger and satiety/fullness.

54AF4DB9F04A4A95905E43D07C18C41F.description: Research and analyze the activity of digestive enzymes within different organs of the digestive tract, connecting enzyme function to environmental factors such as pH.

2A73957044D94C5C8F539ACD7A068541.description: Plan and conduct an experiment to illustrate the necessity of mechanical digestion for efficient chemical digestion.

AC8C099F0AE748CD9BCBE06664ADFAA8.description: Identify the accessory organs (i.e., salivary glands, liver, gallbladder, and pancreas) for digestion and describe their function.

EE8AA9FBF12E41E6A83DE37ADCD00413.description: Use models to describe structural adaptations present in each organ of the tract and correlate the structures to specific processing of food at each stage (e.g., types of teeth; muscular, elastic wall and mucous lining of the stomach; villi and microvilli of the small intestine; and sphincters along the digestive tract).

A902701803274EF7AC13917DF11095CE.description: Analyze the structure-function relationship in organs of the digestive system.

059F879ABAA944D2949C8A773D36D108.description: Students will investigate the structures and functions of the digestive system, including the cause and effect of diseases and disorders.

882FDED99FC947378B2C0C8E9EB55250.description: Research and discuss new environmental causes of respiratory distress (e.g., e-cigarettes, environmental pollutants, and changes in inhaled gas composition).

9C360218891E4222B0166EC4080F6D9F.description: Research and analyze the causes and effects of various pathological conditions (e.g., asthma, bronchitis, pneumonia, and COPD).

F1A8999DF4D840ED8DCD7A6B0B01859A.description: Enrichment: Use an engineering design process to develop a model of the mechanisms that support breathing, and illustrate the inverse relationship between volume and pressure in the thoracic cavity.

E622595880EC483E82548D9B3D4AB863.description: Identify the five mechanics of gas exchange: pulmonary ventilation, external respiration, transport gases, internal respiration, and cellular respiration.

813E56ECAC6B4D2EA87549D4EB90AED8.description: Describe structural adaptations of the respiratory tract and relate these structural features to the function of preparing incoming air for gas exchange at the alveolus.

A907ED55C4224E04A23E7B227CABB6B5.description: Design and use models to illustrate the functions of the organs of the respiratory system.

EC2222AB23E34A9597505540705540F6.description: Students will investigate the structures and functions of the respiratory system, including the cause and effect of diseases and disorders.

1DC4B7DABF72468889082F6495790E71.description: Research and analyze the causes and effects of various pathological conditions (e.g., viral infections, auto-immune disorders, immunodeficiency disorders, and lymphomas).

F8D51A78A2334E9AA14A5CA01318AC3E.description: Investigate various forms of acquired and passive immunity (e.g., fetal immunity, breastfed babies, vaccinations, and plasma donations).

461567007E314ACE810014CC316DFF21.description: Differentiate the role of B-lymphocytes and T-lymphocytes in the development of humoral and cell-mediated immunity and primary and secondary immune responses.

05D869312E2F4365B2CC0E2E00D8680A.description: Correlate the functions of the spleen, thymus, lymph nodes, and lymphocytes to the development of immunity.

F702F181997042199053276A4A83E2CC.description: Compare and contrast the body's non-specific and specific lines of defense, including an analysis of the roles of various leukocytes: basophils, eosinophils, neutrophils, monocytes, and lymphocytes.

FAC82578AB964E378A924439D1099E82.description: Compare the primary functions of the lymphatic system and its relationship to the cardiovascular system.

BC2D0D66A3E24675B16E20557080F9CC.description: Analyze the functions of leukocytes, lymph, and lymphatic organs in the immune system.

19F3CD7810664792867D6AAA853A103C.description: Students will investigate the structures and functions of the lymphatic system, including the cause and effect of diseases and disorders.

38E3CBF03DCB4C52A1A4A64EB33A7683.description: Enrichment: Use an engineering design process to develop, model, and test effective treatments for cardiovascular diseases (e.g., methods to regulate heart rate, artificial replacement valves, open blood vessels, or strengthening leaky valves).

F666CDC11F6246E2A857C4B036782F14.description: Research and analyze the effects of various pathological conditions (e.g., hypertension, myocardial infarction, mitral valve prolapse, varicose veins, and arrhythmia).

770FA5A42EB941A486FBB320BA6D3C5E.description: Plan and conduct an investigation to test the effects of various stimuli on heart rate and/or blood pressure. Construct graphs to analyze data and communicate conclusions.

B954EC728C5F459BA60C98CC17D34543.description: Demonstrate the role of valves in regulating blood flow.

B378B432DDB2437F821FBF7A30D1EE7A.description: Investigate the structure and function of different types of blood vessels (e.g., arteries, capillaries, veins). Identify the role each plays in the transport and exchange of materials.

714E1A3FC5274343813FFF96D8412DFA.description: Describe the flow of blood through the pulmonary system and systemic circulation.

C3CBE20C8A5545E0B3E948215252506F.description: Design and use models to investigate the functions of the organs of the cardiovascular system.

E397E2375B63460CB1ADA0B3B981B167.description: Students will investigate the structures and functions of the cardiovascular system, including the cause and effect of diseases and disorders.

D1FA991D20B5484C8A952CCEE5BDA413.description: Enrichment: Use an engineering design process to develop effective treatments for blood disorders (e.g., methods to regulate blood cell counts or blood doping tests).

FD22E4962C4A418B97034EFD11D0CE71.description: Research and analyze the causes and effects of various pathological conditions (e.g., anemia, malaria, leukemia, hemophilia, and blood doping).

1223C45431E34267BE6059E315A04999.description: Distinguish the cellular difference between the ABO blood groups and investigate blood type differences utilizing antibodies to determine compatible donors and recipients.

7A24B9CFF66D4E398ACF09D3FEF7500C.description: Describe the structure, function, and origin of the cellular components and plasma components of blood.

A499C4CC5DA745C0A32F60B035154EE5.description: Students will analyze the structure and functions of blood and its role in maintaining homeostasis.

AB85A3BBAD8746D9B8757CEB21797F9F.description: Research and analyze the causes and effects of various pathological conditions (e.g., infertility, ovarian cysts, endometriosis, sexually transmitted diseases, and ectopic pregnancy). Research current treatments for infertility.

54D5EAA354A84D34805899575DEE062F.description: Describe the changes that occur during embryonic/fetal development, birth, and the growth and development from infancy, childhood, and adolescence to adult.

02488FB17F4743C38BC9C49D5717CBF8.description: Evaluate and communicate information about various contraceptive methods to prevent fertilization and/or implantation.

DF18CED61D1E48ADB7DF8846225545EC.description: Construct explanations detailing the role of hormones in the regulation of sperm and egg development. Analyze the role of negative feedback in regulation of the female menstrual cycle and pregnancy.

ED58F0CBFA9C48BCAB69E00AAFAAC327.description: Describe the female reproductive anatomy and relate structure to egg production and release.

0DEB259FAD71491DA9FE81A464F2CA03.description: Describe the male reproductive anatomy and relate structure to sperm production and release.

16009E87126E43BAA0F70C54742A8ACB.description: Compare and contrast the structure and function of the male and female reproductive systems.

3D2F91C88F924AB2ACB0FCD9A659C477.description: Students will investigate the structures and functions of the male and female reproductive system, including the cause and effect of diseases and disorders.

E80C715D53A442E6A8719E2B7C8BA178.description: Enrichment: Use an engineering design process to develop effective treatments for endocrine disorders (e.g., methods to regulate hormonal imbalance).

345C8512E8FE4CB5A858C23E1D232FEF.description: Research and analyze the effects of various pathological conditions (e.g., diabetes mellitus, pituitary dwarfism, Graves' disease, Cushing's syndrome, hypothyroidism, and obesity).

90B00EE9128D4540A7501D137EC502A4.description: Model specific mechanisms through which the endocrine system maintains homeostasis (e.g., insulin/glucagon and glucose regulation; T3 / T4 and metabolic rates; calcitonin/parathyroid and calcium regulation; antidiuretic hormone and water balance; growth hormone; and cortisol and stress).

3BB37B9A2AC046C7970C8C7DF91B6C40.description: Discuss the function of each endocrine gland and the various hormones secreted.

94FE5EDA22EE41298EF4BBF999B6EB47.description: Obtain, evaluate, and communicate information to illustrate that the endocrine glands secrete hormones that help the body maintain homeostasis through feedback mechanisms.

5404655496D64896B50FFB5783D70C77.description: Students will demonstrate an understanding of the major organs of the endocrine system and the associated hormonal production and regulation.

B4FED698E8074D73845107253E236D40.description: Enrichment: Use an engineering design process to develop, model, and test preventative devices for neurological injuries and/or disorders (e.g., concussion-proof helmets or possible medications for addiction and depression).

67041EE8CD334D0BBAEDC6A7F77F92B6.description: Research and analyze the causes and effects of various pathological conditions (e.g., addiction, depression, schizophrenia, Alzheimer's, sports-related chronic traumatic encephalopathy [CTE], dementia, chronic migraine, stroke, and epilepsy).

10CECECC299C4810AC6453133AFE81EE.description: Describe the structure and function of the special senses (i.e., vision, hearing, taste, and olfaction).

8C2D0818A3E64CFEB0DDCA9459C6F22C.description: Describe the major characteristics of the autonomic nervous system. Contrast the roles of the sympathetic and parasympathetic nervous systems in maintaining homeostasis.

20A4A9E812884DF081A7E7E732E489D1.description: Enrichment: Plan and conduct an experiment to test reflex response rates under varying conditions. Using technology, construct graphs in order to analyze and interpret data to explain and communicate conclusions.

682892870C8643C783E461FF36236168.description: Compare and contrast the structures and functions of the central and peripheral nervous systems. Investigate how the systems interact to maintain homeostasis (e.g., reflex responses, sensory responses).

AD8A824A5EA047C9A6862B393623E71B.description: Discuss the structure and function of the brain and spinal cord.

ADCFCC9C6FEC4989800DFA83E3BF6354.description: Analyze the structure and function of neurons and their supporting neuroglia cells (e.g. astrocytes, oligodendrocytes, Schwann cells, microglial).

16CA2635B21B4315A8B4975641ADD86E.description: Describe and evaluate how the nervous system functions and interconnects with all other body systems.

580FE1FA01C54F518FC28039D24D1BB2.description: Students will investigate the structures and functions of the nervous system, including the cause and effect of diseases and disorders.

D8BD29E161D14A93ADDA1DBB1F2FBB49.description: Enrichment: Use an engineering design process to develop effective ergonomic devices to prevent muscle fatigue and strain (e.g., carpal tunnel, exoskeletons for paralysis, or training plans to prevent strains/sprains/cramps).

D2B276ACC98A4103B9CE39F23DE9619C.description: Research and analyze the causes and effects of various pathological conditions, (e.g., fibromyalgia, muscular dystrophy, cerebral palsy, muscle cramps/strains, and tendonitis).

003257DD5E924867808D65BF4B9D2EC6.description: Use technology to plan and conduct an investigation that demonstrates the physiology of muscle contraction, muscle fatigue, or muscle tone. Collect and analyze data to interpret results, then explain and communicate conclusions.

813856722B414A33B83DD70B5C8E174C.description: Compare and contrast the anatomy and physiology of the three types of muscle tissue.

07CF57501CE3479DBE5FE411E5FE00D7.description: Use models to locate the major muscles and investigate the movements controlled by each muscle.

2089875D2D5F4D3E97210C66CBC0D98E.description: Explain the molecular mechanism of muscle contraction and relaxation.

17A619BD685C4A21A231BDDFD2DB2218.description: Describe the structure and function of the skeletal muscle fiber and the motor unit.

A4829B9ECE0D46798A73016187941AEB.description: Develop and use models to illustrate muscle structure, muscle locations and groups, actions, origins, and insertions.

4887B84EA5CA42CBB65B721D0BE35B14.description: Students will investigate the structures and functions of the muscular system, including the cause and effect of diseases and disorders.

807DF5452C224813A5893A5A786436E0.description: Enrichment: Use an engineering design process to develop, model, and test effective treatments for bone disorders (i.e., prosthetics).

9529C7E193A547729B018F3EFE702414.description: Research and analyze various pathological conditions (e.g., bone fractures, osteoporosis, bone cancers, various types of arthritis, and carpal tunnel syndrome).

418329BCFBD745158970A410B2D18B6B.description: Construct explanations detailing how mechanisms (e.g., Ca²+ regulation) are used by the skeletal system to maintain homeostasis.

166ACED90BDD403D966E5AF0C26512DC.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the growth and development of the skeletal system, differentiating between endochondral and intramembranous ossification.

AD96CEF9D24D4995A235506E45F7C62B.description: Identify and classify types of joints and their movement.

2DD4A77F89C54F698AB07ED738EE4B10.description: Develop and use models to identify and classify major bones as part of the appendicular or axial skeleton.

53B83024F25A49FFAB2AF5E2A213A24A.description: Use models to compare the structure and function of the skeletal system.

4866FF12A3984DBEBA57440E066C0CE1.description: Students will investigate the structures and functions of the skeletal system including the cause and effect of diseases and disorders.

E66BE2A07FCF4DB89D0A2ABAAA602755.description: Enrichment: Use an engineering design process to design and model/simulate effective treatments for skin disorders (e.g., tissue grafts).

6989F33468AC4ED59DE1EB71356DDA52.description: Research and analyze the causes and effects of various pathological conditions (e.g., burns, skin cancer, bacterial/viral infections, and chemical dermatitis).

58C03A87A1454930813B871E52FBDDD5.description: Investigate specific mechanisms (e.g., feedback and temperature regulation) through which the skin maintains homeostasis.

1A4E6403D5694E518643920EB5CBA923.description: Identify structures and explain the functions of the integumentary system, including layers of skin, accessory structures, and types of membranes.

AC1320809D834DCE84A49DD65141ACA3.description: Students will investigate the structures and functions of the integumentary system, including the cause and effect of diseases and disorders.

35893B602E70487B9231AD8946C60BB1.description: Enrichment: Use an engineering design process to research and develop medications (i.e., targeted cancer therapy drugs) that target uncontrolled cancer cell reproduction.

92B8F5FC30D54CDEBA7F24A052EA2573.description: Construct a model to demonstrate how the structural organization of cells in a tissue relates to the specialized function of that tissue.

041558B9372E4AA887AC3D70C3DDE471.description: Analyze the characteristics of the four main tissue types: epithelial, connective, muscle, and nervous. Examine tissues using microscopes and other various technologies.

3D8B00088F3E41C08D491B33C041F737.description: Students will demonstrate an understanding of the relationship of cells and tissues that form complex structures of the body.

BFA9B5572F3C4F7B84D4F6251B1B1766.description: Investigate the interdependence of the various body systems to each other and to the body as a whole.

9A0C7D1A7CA94FA9A40E1919E6545D99.description: Locate organs and their applicable body cavities and systems.

125355DC06EB47629669D15403164604.description: Apply appropriate anatomical terminology when explaining the orientation of regions, directions, and body planes or sections.

F93FA8B79E104E209930083AC6BB70AF.description: Students will demonstrate an understanding of how anatomical structures and physiological functions are organized and described using anatomical position.

71DF001B93064EB3A51AD5DF7A00D79E.description: High School - Human Anatomy and Physiology
